CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 27, 1973, pg. 2, reads: "Created by Black Firm - Statuette Bank of Stargell To Aid Sickle Cell Fund Dr. - Willie Stargell visited the Hillday Statuary Company this week to examine a bank likeness that will help to produce funds for the Black Athletes' Foundation for use in Sickle Cell Research. Flanking the Pittsburgh Pirates' outfielder and first baseman are, Frank Hill, plant owner, and his wife Evelyn Hill who conceived the idea for the bank likeness of Stargell. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Evelyn Hill and Pittsburgh Pirates baseball player Willie Stargell, standing over table with ceramic portrait banks of Stargell, in Hillday Statuary Company
